Prior to that, he worked for ICICI Prudential Life Insurance for five years. He replaced LIC Executive Director Shubhangi Soman and is the first outsider to be appointed to the position.

347.title: Over 97% of adults have received 1st COVID-19 vaccine dose: Govt
347.article_body: Union Health Minister Dr Mansukh Mandaviya tweeted on Thursday that over 97% of India's adult population has received the first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine. "Rapidly marching towards achieving 100% first dose mark," he added. Notably, at a press meet today, ICMR's Dr Balram Bhargava said the first dose of vaccine is 98.9% effective in preventing mortality.

348.title: Chelsea reach FA Cup quarters as Abramovich announces club is up for sale
348.article_body: Hours after Russian billionaire Roman Abramovich announced he is putting the club up for sale, Chelsea beat Luton Town 3-2 to reach the quarter-finals of the FA Cup. Chelsea's £97.5 million record signing Romelu Lukaku scored the winning goal in the fifth-round match. Abramovich has owned the London-based club for nearly 20 years. Chelsea were FA Cup finalists last year.

349.title: Liverpool beat Norwich City 2-1 to reach FA Cup quarter-finals
349.article_body: Liverpool's Takumi Minamino on Wednesday scored twice to help Liverpool beat Norwich City 2-1 and reach the quarter-finals of the FA Cup. Liverpool beat Chelsea on penalties to win the Carabao Cup on Sunday. "Takumi is an incredible player and tonight was the best game he had for us. He was a constant threat throughout," Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp said.

350.title: If you can't close the skies, then give me planes: Ukraine President to the West
350.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy called on the West to increase military aid to Ukraine and said, "If you do not have the power to close the skies, then give me planes!" "If we (Ukraine) are no more then, God forbid, Latvia, Lithuania, Estonia will be next. Believe me," Zelenskyy warned.

351.title: Delhi reports 326 COVID-19 cases, 3 deaths in last 24 hrs
351.article_body: Delhi reported 326 new COVID-19 cases and three related deaths in the last 24 hours, taking the overall infection tally in the city to 18,60,887. Moreover, 338 recoveries were reported in the national capital, with the city currently having 1,588 active cases. The city had reported 325 COVID-19 cases and one death on Wednesday.

352.title: Muslims living in fear, Brahmins neglected under BJP: Mayawati
352.article_body: Bahujan Samaj Party president Mayawati on Thursday said, "Muslims are living under constant fear. They have been meted step-motherly treatment by the BJP government. The Brahmin community, too, has been feeling neglected." Mayawati further said that BSP has given tickets to candidates of all communities. "The Muslim community is full of hate against the BJP and the RSS," she added.

353.title: Yet to examine it: Govt on IIT study predicting 4th wave in June
353.article_body: The Centre on Thursday said it's yet to examine the IIT Kanpur study which said that the COVID-19 fourth wave in India may start around June 22 and peak from mid to late August. NITI Aayog Member (Health) VK Paul said the study is a valuable input produced by eminent people. "We should be carefully watching the assumption," he added.

354.title: Russian, Belarusian athletes banned from Winter Paralympics: IPC
354.article_body: The International Paralympic Committee (IPC) on Thursday said Russian and Belarusian athletes will be banned from the Winter Paralympics. The decision comes after the IPC faced international backlash and threats of boycotts by other teams for announcing a day before the athletes would be allowed to compete as neutrals. A 71-member Russian contingent and 12-member Belarusian team are in Beijing.

355.title: F1's Max Verstappen signs new deal with Red Bull until end of 2028
355.article_body: Formula One world champion Max Verstappen on Thursday signed a new five-year contract extension with Red Bull keeping him at the team until the end of 2028. "I really enjoy being part of Red Bull Racing, so choosing to stay to the 2028 season was an easy decision," Verstappen said. The new deal is reportedly worth £40 million per season.

356.title: 2 dead, 14 hurt as bus falls into gorge in Himachal's Mandi
356.article_body: Two people were killed and 14 others were left injured as a Himachal Road Transport Corporation bus fell into a gorge in Mandi district, police have said. Mandi Superintendent of Police Shalini Agnihotri informed that the accident took place on Thursday at Jhir village of Sarkaghat sub-division. The injured people were taken for treatment to a nearby hospital.

357.title: 35-yr-old arrested in Thane for cheating 35 people of ₹2.56 crore
357.article_body: Thane Police have arrested a 35-year-old man for cheating 35 people of ₹2.56 crores after the promise of giving three times higher returns on their investments. An officer from the Economic Offences Wing (EOW) said, "The accused had taken money from people on a time-to-time basis within a year's span in 2020."

358.title: 'France Prez believes worst is yet to come,' says aide after 90-minute call with Putin
358.article_body: French President Emmanuel Macron believes "the worst is yet to come" in Ukraine after a 90-minute phone call with Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin who appears intent on seizing "the whole" of Ukraine, Macron's aide said. "There was nothing in what President Putin told us that should reassure us. He showed great determination to continue the operation," the aide continued.

359.title: 8 people can return in its place: BJP MLA on bringing student's body from Ukraine
359.article_body: When asked about bringing Karnataka resident Naveen SG's body from war-hit Ukraine, BJP MLA Arvind Bellad on Thursday said, "In the place required for a dead body, eight persons could be accommodated and brought back." Saying that efforts are underway, he added, "Bringing those who are alive is difficult, so bringing a dead body back would be even more difficult."

360.title: Djokovic likely to play French Open as France drops vaccine rule
360.article_body: World number two Novak Djokovic will likely be able to play at French Open in May after France announced it will drop its COVID-19 vaccine pass rule from March 14. Djokovic won the title in 2021, beating world number five Stefanos Tsitsipas in five sets. Djokovic was deported ahead of the Australian Open due to his COVID-19 vaccine status.

361.title: Can't promote drunkenness: Delhi govt on order stopping discount on liquor
361.article_body: Delhi government has told Delhi High Court that the national capital "couldn't become a city for promoting drunkenness through discounts on liquor." The giving of discounts by liquor vends was an attempt by a few to "monopolise" the whole system, it added. It comes as private liquor sellers challenged Delhi government's order which barred them from giving discounts on alcohol.

362.title: Turkish AI startup Insider turns unicorn with $121 mn fundraise
362.article_body: Turkish AI startup Insider has become a unicorn after raising $121 million in a funding round led by Qatar's sovereign wealth fund. Insider is now valued at $1.22 billion, triple of what it was valued two years ago. Founded in 2012, the startup's platform uses artificial intelligence to predict future consumption behaviour for clients like Samsung, Toyota and Ikea.

363.title: Drugs, liquor worth over ₹600 crore seized in 2yrs: Gujarat govt
363.article_body: Gujarat government in a written response in the Assembly on Thursday said drugs and liquor worth over ₹600 crore were seized in the state over the last two years. In a break-up, it revealed police confiscated India-made foreign liquor bottles, country liquor and beer cans worth ₹235 crore and hashish, ganja and charas worth ₹370 crore in 2020 and 2021.

364.title: Chhattisgarh CM rides bike in leather jacket to promote competition; video viral
364.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel wore a leather jacket, shades and rode a bike to promote a bike racing competition organised by the Chhattisgarh Motor Sports Association. In a video posted by the Chief Minister's Office on Twitter, Baghel is seen riding the bike, while Punjabi music is playing in the background. "Let's make this weekend memorable," his office tweeted.

365.title: No parent wants to send their child away: PM Modi to Ukraine-returned students
365.article_body: PM Narendra Modi in Uttar Pradesh's Varanasi interacted with several Indian medical students who had returned from war-hit Ukraine. The PM said, "I believe, students like you would not have needed to go outside India had the medical education policies been right since the beginning." He added, "No parent wants to send their child away at a small age."

366.title: Man marries triplets on same day after all 3 sisters propose to him in Congo
366.article_body: A man in Democratic Republic of Congo married triplets on the same day and said that they proposed to him simultaneously. "I was obliged to marry all of them because they are triplets. It wasn't an easy decision because until now, my parents don't understand what I'm doing," the man said. Pictures of their wedding are being widely shared online

367.title: 2nd round of Russia-Ukraine talks begins, Ukraine lists 3 key issues
367.article_body: The second round of Russia-Ukraine ceasefire talks has begun, tweeted a Ukrainian official. The key issues on the agenda are immediate ceasefire, armistice and humanitarian corridors for the evacuation of civilians from destroyed or constantly shelled villages/cities, the official further wrote. The Ukrainian official also shared a picture along with the tweet.

368.title: Rohit misinterprets meaning of 'anban' during presser, says 'My Hindi isn't that good'
368.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma misinterpreted the meaning of Hindi word 'anban' while answering a question about whether he has set any targets having played just 40 Tests till now. Rohit answered, "I'm happy having played 40 Tests...I had several injuries and 'anban' during my career." Rohit then asked the meaning of 'anban' and said, "My Hindi isn't that good, boss."

369.title: China-led Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank freezes Russia lending
369.article_body: China-led Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank (AIIB) on Thursday said it has put all activities relating to Russia and Belarus on hold and under review owing to the Russia-Ukraine war. China, despite being the Bank's largest shareholder and holding 26.5% of AIIB's voting power, has opposed sanctions imposed on Russia by governments of various countries.

370.title: 76-year-old woman arrested in Russia for opposing invasion of Ukraine
370.article_body: A 76-year-old woman was reportedly arrested in Russia as she protested against the country's invasion of Ukraine. A video showing some police officers arresting the woman, who is reportedly the survivor of World War II, has also gone viral online. The woman was reportedly carrying a sign that said, "Soldier, drop your weapon and you will be a true hero."

371.title: 'There is much to life than cricket': Jharkhand's Virat shares Dhoni's advice
371.article_body: Sharing MS Dhoni's advice while playing together for Jharkhand in the 2016-17 season, Jharkhand batter Virat Singh said, "Failures on the cricket ground shouldn't dictate your life. There is much to life than cricket." "It is a game, one day you will score a century and the next day, you might get out without scoring," added Virat.

372.title: Mamata Banerjee having Prime Ministerial illusions: BJP leader
372.article_body: BJP leader Tathagata Roy on Thursday said that West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee is having "Prime Ministerial illusions", which is why she's interfering in an international issue. Banerjee on Wednesday blamed the government for delaying the evacuation of Indian students from Ukraine. The Ministry of External Affairs on Thursday said that 6,400 Indians have been brought back so far.

373.title: Time to send Yogi back to his mutt: Mayawati
373.article_body: Bahujan Samaj Party president Mayawati said that her party will form the government in Uttar Pradesh and will send Yogi Adityanath "back to his mutt". "Seeing this turnout and its enthusiasm, I can say that you are set to bring the BSP back to power and make your 'behenji' the Chief Minister for the fifth time," Mayawati added.

374.title: Vodafone Idea to raise ₹4,500 crore by issuing shares to promoters
374.article_body: Vodafone Idea (Vi) on Thursday said its board has approved raising ₹4,500 crore by issuing shares to its promoters on preferential basis. The firm will issue up to 3.39 billion shares at ₹13.30 a share, 20% premium to its current market price, to Vodafone Group's Euro Pacific Securities and Prime Metals and Aditya Birla Group's (ABG) Oriana Investments.

375.title: Prosecutor of ICC launches investigation into war crimes in Ukraine
375.article_body: The International Criminal Court (ICC) Chief Prosecutor Karim Khan on Wednesday announced he has launched an investigation into war crimes, genocide and crimes against humanity committed during Russia's invasion of Ukraine. The investigation comes after 39 member states referred for an investigation from the ICC. Ukraine has said over 2,000 civilians have died since the invasion began last week.

376.title: Ukrainian soldiers beat us: Rajasthan students after returning from Ukraine
376.article_body: Indian medical students who returned to Rajasthan from war-hit Ukraine said the situation at the country's border with Romania was "horrific". "Ukrainian soldiers were treating us very badly. They were beating boys, firing tear gas shells and also bullets in the air," a female student said. A male student said, "They kicked a girl in front of me. She fainted."

377.title: BJP made Purvanchal education hub, opposition neglected it: Shah
377.article_body: While addressing a rally in Uttar Pradesh's Azamgarh, Union Home Minister Amit Shah said that the BJP government made Purvanchal an education hub, while the opposition neglected it earlier. "We made universities in Azamgarh, Ballia and Gorakhpur, along with 12 new medical colleges in the region," Shah added. He further said that BJP has freed UP of the mafia.

378.title: Will impose more sanctions on Russia if situation deteriorates: EU
378.article_body: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen on Thursday said the EU will impose more sanctions on Russia if the situation in Ukraine deteriorates any further following Russia's invasion. The EU has already imposed travel, export, financial and energy bans. "Our aim is to cut off the Kremlin's capacity to wage war on its neighbours," von der Leyen said.

379.title: Video shows captured Ukrainian soldiers being forced to say 'Glory to Russia'
379.article_body: A video purportedly showing captured Ukrainian soldiers being forced to say 'Glory to Russia' has surfaced online. The group of around 15 soldiers can be seen standing at the side of a road as they are recorded by a man. One of the soldiers was told to repeat the phrase loudly by the man behind the camera.

380.title: It's cold, you're wearing just shirt: Rijiju to Indian before evacuation
380.article_body: Union Minister Kiren Rijiju who is in Slovakia to see the evacuation of Indian students from Ukraine checked basic facilities for them. In a video shared by him on social media, Rijiju asked one of the Indians, "It is cold...you are wearing just a shirt. I feel cold looking at you." Other students standing there were seen laughing at this.

381.title: Few hundred citizens still remain in Ukraine's Kharkiv: Govt
381.article_body: The Ministry of External Affairs spokesperson Arindam Bagchi on Thursday said a few hundred Indian nationals are still stuck in Kharkiv of war-hit Ukraine. "Our priority is to take students out safely in whatever mode of transport possible," he said. "The total number of Indians waiting to cross Ukraine's western borders has reduced," he claimed.

382.title: Tried other options before 'I'm Iron Man' line: Robert Downey Jr
382.article_body: Actor Robert Downey Jr recently said in a podcast that before choosing the 'I am Iron Man' line for his character Tony Stark's last words in 'Avengers: Endgame', he tried other lines. He continued, "They were all...smart-a** lines like...dumb stuff like, 'You're so f***ed' or whatever." The actor revealed the final line was one of the editors' or writers' idea.

383.title: Melt snow for water, avoid full meals: Govt in survival guidelines for Indians in Ukraine
383.article_body: In an advisory for Indian citizens in Ukraine, government listed survival guidelines, wherein it asked them to keep a kit of essential items, including passport, ID Card, essential medication, at hand round the clock. "Avoid full meals, eat smaller portions to extend the rations...Melt snow to make water," it added. "Delete...unnecessary apps in mobile...to conserve battery," said government.

384.title: Indian govt lists dos and don'ts in advisory for its citizens in Ukraine
384.article_body: Indian government, in an advisory for its citizens in Ukraine, listed out potentially dangerous situations to be expected, including aerial raids and missile attacks. "Compile and share information with...fellow Indians, organise yourselves in squads...of ten...students, nominate a coordinator," said government. "Do not join local protestors, refrain from commenting on social media," it added.

385.title: We will restore every house, every street, Russia will pay for it: Ukraine
385.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Thursday said, "We will restore every house, every street and every city destroyed in the war." Zelenskyy said, "We say to Russia: Learn the word of reparations and contributions." He added, "You (Russia) will reimburse us for everything you did against our state, against every Ukrainian in full."

386.title: Man shares pic of son resting on his uniform as he goes to fight for Ukraine
386.article_body: A Ukrainian man has shared a picture of his son, who can be seen resting on his military uniform as he prepared to fight for the country amid the Russian invasion. The man tweeted, "[Goodbye] my little boy...I hope [to] see you [the other] time I survive." Over 2,000 Ukrainian civilians have reportedly been killed so far since Russia's invasion.

387.title: Russia will achieve its goal in Ukraine in any case: Putin
387.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Thursday told his French counterpart Emmanuel Macron that the goals of Russia's operation in Ukraine - its demilitarisation and neutral status - will be achieved in any case. Putin added that any attempts by Kyiv to delay negotiations would result in Moscow adding more items to its list of demands.

388.title: Kerala, Mizoram & Maha have 50% of India's active COVID cases: Govt
388.article_body: The Union Health Ministry on Thursday said Kerala, Maharashtra and Mizoram accounted for 50% of the active COVID-19 cases in India. At present, the country has around 77,000 active cases. Only a single state has active cases over 10,000 and two states have active cases between 5,000 and 10,000, while remaining states have below 5,000 active cases, the ministry said.

389.title: Ford names its EV unit 'Model e', the name it stopped Elon Musk from using
389.article_body: Ford has split its business into two separate entities, one focused on electric vehicles and the other on gas-powered ones. Ford named its electric vehicle unit 'Ford Model e' and the gasoline division 'Ford Blue'. Nearly a decade ago, Ford had stopped Elon Musk's Tesla from naming its car 'Model E' and Tesla eventually named its car 'Model 3'.

390.title: 18,000 Indians left Ukraine since we first issued advisory: MEA
390.article_body: Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) on Thursday said a total of 18,000 Indian nationals have left Ukraine since the first travel advisory was issued by the Indian Embassy in Kyiv. "30 flights under Operation Ganga have brought back 6,400 Indians from Ukraine so far. In the next 24 hours, 18 flights have been scheduled," said MEA spokesperson Arindam Bagchi.

391.title: Ensure you're vaccinated against COVID-19: Govt to Ukraine returnees
391.article_body: The government on Thursday asked all students who have returned from war-hit Ukraine to get fully vaccinated against COVID-19 if they haven't done so already. Health Ministry's Lav Agarwal said the ministry is in regular touch with the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) over how many flights and people have come from Ukraine and their health status as well.

392.title: Ukrainian woman killed while trying to recover 14-yr-old nephew's body
392.article_body: A nurse has been killed in an ambush by Russian forces while she was trying to recover her 14-year-old nephew's body, Ukraine's Foreign Ministry said. The woman's nephew was reportedly killed by shrapnel after the Russian bombing. Ukraine's Healthcare Minister Viktor Liashko said, "Today Russian terrorists took the life of a doctor – Marina Kalabina...[This] should definitely not go unpunished."

393.title: Eveready's Chairman & MD resign post open offer from Burman family
393.article_body: Eveready's Non-Executive Chairman Aditya Khaitan and Managing Director Amritanshu Khaitan resigned from their positions following an open offer from Dabur Group's Burman family to buy an additional 26% stake in Eveready. The company said the two have stepped down "to enable [Eveready] to benefit from new leadership and direction". Joint MD Suvamoy Saha will assume charge as Eveready's interim MD.

394.title: Chennai to get its youngest Mayor as DMK names 28-yr-old R Priya for post
394.article_body: DMK on Thursday named 28-year-old R Priya as the mayoral candidate for Chennai. As DMK enjoys the majority, Priya would be formally elected as Chennai's youngest Mayor soon. Priya will be the first-ever Dalit woman and the third woman after Tara Cherian and Kamakshi Jayaraman to lead the body. She is the granddaughter of former DMK MLA Chengai Sivam.

395.title: Formula 1 terminates contract with Russian Grand Prix
395.article_body: Formula 1 has confirmed that it has terminated its contract with the Russian Grand Prix amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Formula 1 had earlier cancelled the race scheduled to take place in Sochi in September. Formula 1's governing body, FIA, had ruled that Russian drivers must compete under a neutral flag this season.

396.title: 1 million people have fled Ukraine in 7 days since Russia invasion: UN
396.article_body: The United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) Filippo Grandi on Wednesday said that about one million people have fled Ukraine since Russia invaded the country on February 24. Filippo Grandi said, "In just seven days, we have witnessed the exodus of one million refugees from Ukraine to neighbouring countries." Notably, the Russia-Ukraine war entered its eighth day today.

397.title: Man ties wife & her alleged lover, beats them with baton in Raj
397.article_body: A man was arrested for beating his wife and her alleged lover after tying them up to a pillar in Rajasthan's Udaipur district, police said on Thursday. The accused, identified as Kanhaiya Lal, beat the man till he fainted and later shaved his head, said Station House Officer (SHO) of Pahada Police Station Nagendra Singh.

398.title: Satellite pic shows people waiting in long queue for food in Ukraine
398.article_body: A satellite image by Maxar amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine shows long queue of people waiting for essentials outside a shop. The long queue waiting for food was seen outside a supermarket in Kyiv. People and cars trying to leave Ukraine at multiple border crossing points and into neighbouring countries including Hungary and Slovakia are also seen in pictures.

399.title: 18-month-old Hyd girl kidnapped from hospital, rescued within 4 hours
399.article_body: An 18-month-old girl who was kidnapped from the Niloufer Hospital at Hyderabad's Nampally on Wednesday morning was rescued within four hours, police said. The child had gone to the hospital along with her mother. While her mother was busy collecting reports, the girl went missing within a few minutes.

400.title: Nobody should say what India should do, its voice matters: France on Russia-Ukraine war
400.article_body: After India abstained from voting on the resolution against Russia at UNSC, French Ambassador to India Emmanuel Lenain on Thursday said, "Nobody should say what India should do." "As crisis is deepening, support from India would be welcomed because India's voice matters," he stated. He added that France is a strong supporter of India getting a permanent seat in UNSC.

401.title: Interviewer jokingly makes Zuckerberg complete CAPTCHA to prove he's 'not a robot'
401.article_body: Computer scientist Lex Fridman recently interviewed Mark Zuckerberg where he jokingly made the Meta CEO complete a CAPTCHA to prove that he is "not a robot". Fridman asked Zuckerberg to circle all the traffic lights on a paper presented to him. CAPTCHA is a type of challenge-response test used in computing to determine whether the user is human.
